chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim, for the sons of Korah, Maschil, A Song of loves.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim, for the sons of Korah, Maschil, A Song of loves.

items.text: My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
items.plainText: My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

items.text: Thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into thy lips: therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.
items.plainText: Thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into thy lips: therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.

items.text: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty, with thy glory and thy majesty.
items.plainText: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty, with thy glory and thy majesty.

items.text: And in thy majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.
items.plainText: And in thy majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

items.text: Thine arrows are sharp in the heart of the king's enemies; whereby the people fall under thee.
items.plainText: Thine arrows are sharp in the heart of the king's enemies; whereby the people fall under thee.

items.text: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.
items.plainText: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.

items.text: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
items.plainText: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

items.text: All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia, out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.
items.plainText: All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia, out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.

items.text: Kings' daughters were among thy honourable women: upon thy right hand did stand the queen in gold of Ophir.
items.plainText: Kings' daughters were among thy honourable women: upon thy right hand did stand the queen in gold of Ophir.

items.text: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy father's house;
items.plainText: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy father's house;

items.text: So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he is thy Lord; and worship thou him.
items.plainText: So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he is thy Lord; and worship thou him.

items.text: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; even the rich among the people shall intreat thy favour.
items.plainText: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; even the rich among the people shall intreat thy favour.

items.text: The king's daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of wrought gold.
items.plainText: The king's daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of wrought gold.

items.text: She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework: the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought unto thee.
items.plainText: She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework: the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought unto thee.

items.text: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought: they shall enter into the king's palace.
items.plainText: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought: they shall enter into the king's palace.

items.text: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children, whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.
items.plainText: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children, whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.

items.text: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations: therefore shall the people praise thee for ever and ever.
items.plainText: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations: therefore shall the people praise thee for ever and ever.
